borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
description: Retrospective application for the enlargement of the garage, alterations to the front of the outbuilding and the construction of a patio including storage building
decision_conditions: <p>The development, by reason of its siting on the boundary, excessive scale and depth, and material finish, represents a disproportionately large and dominant addition to the garden area, cumulatively covering over half&nbsp;of this large garden space, and representing an over-development of the site. It serves to&nbsp;detract&nbsp;from the character and appearance of the garden and surround area, contrary to the surrounding pattern of development, representing a poor quality addition, contrary to:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><ul><li style="">National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, December 2023) </li><li style="">Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021) </li><li style="">Policy CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)</li><li style="">Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011) </li><li style="">The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012) </li><li style="">Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</li></ul>

<p>The applicant has failed to present plans which accurately depict the development. Specifically the&nbsp;As Built Plans and Elevations (drawing number: 201, dated: 19/03/2024) fails to accurately represent the predominant use of the outbuilding. The proposal could prejudice third parties who may otherwise have wished to comment on the application; in the absence of accurate plans it cannot be demonstrated&nbsp;the proposal would be supported by:</p><ul><li>National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, December 2023); </li><li>Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);</li><li>Policy CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010); </li><li>Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011); </li><li>The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012); </li><li>Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</li></ul>

<div>The rear outbuilding and canopy structure by reason of its siting on the boundary, excessive scale and depth, would result in an overbearing and unneighbourly addition to no.19 Bull Lane, constituting undue harm to their residential amenities, contrary to:<br></div><div><br></div><div><p><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">-
National Planning Policy Framework </span>National Planning Policy Framework
(NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)<o:p></o:p></p><p><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">- Policy
D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);</span><o:p></o:p></p><p><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">- Policy
CP3 of </span>Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)<o:p></o:p></p><p><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">-
Policies BP8 and BP11 of the </span>Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough
Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; line-height: 107%; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">- The Residential
Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal">









</p><p><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: " pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">-
Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of </span>The London Borough of Barking and
Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)<o:p></o:p></p></div>
